title: (x) Curious George movie poster - custom lettered {Lex}
content:
Some type or script, but which one...??

Cheers Nick

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [031\_8101[1].jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101406/http:/typophile.com/files/031_8101%5B1%5D.jpg) | 36.2 KB |
author: Nickmulley

comments.content:
It looks hand-lettered. The 'u's and 'e's don't match.

- Lex

EDIT: But there might be something similar out there.

I agree with Lex that this was probably hand-drawn. The Curious George logo is a registered trademark of Houghton Mifflin Company publishers now. That would lead me to believe if there is a typeface, it is custom (based off the original illustration) and proprietary.

However, with the [new movie](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101406/http:/www.curiousgeorgemovie.com/) coming out next year (and the [number of books](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101406/http:/www.houghtonmifflinbooks.com/features/cgsite/) over the years) there might be something floating around out there that is similar / a knock-off.

The font for the new movie must be a font rather than hand drawn...??

Do you know of anything close...?? Its the 'G' that im having trouble with

Nick

Well, for the movie it could very well just be a redrawn graphic of the original... not an entire font. The typeface used in the trailer for names is a different face than the title/logo.

We'll keep trying for suggestions of similar faces.

[Monotype Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120101406/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.108073.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Curious+George&sampleSize=48) has similarities, but definitely not the gothic caps you're looking for.
